intro: Galium parisiense var. ruricola, commonly known as field bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Its medicinal properties have been historically noted, though it is not widely used in modern herbal medicine.
